genresAdvancedInfo.name: jazz accordion
genresAdvancedInfo.description: Jazz accordion is a subgenre of jazz music that features the accordion as a lead instrument. It is often associated with the French musette style and is characterized by its use of swing rhythms, improvisation, and virtuosic playing. Jazz accordionists often incorporate elements of other genres, such as Latin or classical music, into their playing.
